questions.question: What is the Commonwealth?
choices: An association of countries supporting democracy and development
questions.explanation: The Commonwealth is a group of countries that work together to support democracy and development.

questions.question: How many member states does the Commonwealth currently have?
questions.explanation: The Commonwealth has 54 member states.

questions.question: Who is the ceremonial head of the Commonwealth?
questions.explanation: The King serves as the ceremonial head of the Commonwealth.

questions.question: Is membership in the Commonwealth compulsory?
questions.explanation: Membership in the Commonwealth is voluntary.

questions.question: Can the Commonwealth suspend a country’s membership?
choices: Only by vote of the UN
questions.explanation: The Commonwealth can suspend a country’s membership.

questions.question: What are the core values of the Commonwealth?
choices: Democracy, good government, and rule of law
questions.explanation: The Commonwealth is based on democracy, good government, and the rule of law.

questions.question: Which of the following countries is a member of the Commonwealth?
questions.explanation: India is one of the 54 member states of the Commonwealth.

questions.question: How many countries belong to the Council of Europe?
questions.explanation: The Council of Europe has 46 member countries.

questions.question: What is the main aim of the Council of Europe?
choices: Protection and promotion of human rights
questions.explanation: The Council of Europe promotes and protects human rights.

questions.question: Can the Council of Europe make laws?
questions.explanation: The Council of Europe cannot make laws.

questions.question: What is the best-known convention of the Council of Europe?
questions.explanation: The European Convention on Human Rights is the most well-known convention.

questions.question: When was the United Nations established?
questions.explanation: The United Nations was founded after the Second World War.

questions.question: How many countries are members of the United Nations?
questions.explanation: The United Nations has more than 190 member countries.

questions.question: What is the main goal of the United Nations?
choices: To prevent war and promote peace and security
questions.explanation: The UN aims to prevent war and promote international peace and security.

questions.question: How many members does the UN Security Council have?
questions.explanation: The UN Security Council has 15 members.

questions.question: How many permanent members are on the UN Security Council?
questions.explanation: There are five permanent members on the UN Security Council.

questions.question: Is the UK a permanent member of the UN Security Council?
questions.explanation: The UK is one of the five permanent members of the UN Security Council.

questions.question: What is NATO?
choices: A group of European and North American countries that defend each other
questions.explanation: NATO is a defence alliance of European and North American countries.

questions.question: What is NATO’s main purpose?
choices: To maintain peace and defend members
questions.explanation: NATO’s purpose is to maintain peace and defend its members.

questions.question: Which regions are represented in NATO?
questions.explanation: NATO includes countries from Europe and North America.
